intro: Myroxylon integrifolium, commonly known as the Copaiba tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its thick, aromatic bark and can grow up to 30 meters tall. The plant produces yellowish to reddish resin, which has been historically used for medicinal and perfumery purposes. Its leaves are alternate, elliptic, and have a smooth margin. The Copaiba tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats and is valued for its sustainable resin production.
